questionsData.title: Some letters are being …….by the secretary.
questionsData.explain_answer:
Some letters are being typed by the secretary,

 it means that the secretary is currently in the process of typing the letters. The word "typed" is the past participle form of the verb "type," which is used to describe an action that has already been completed.but In this case, the letters have not yet been fully typed, but they are currently undergoing the process of being typed by the secretary.

  • "types" is the present tense form of the verb "type." However, in this sentence, we are referring to an action that is currently happening
  • typing" is the present participle form of the verb "type. "typing" is not the appropriate choice.
  • "type" is the base form of the verb, but in this sentence,

questionsData.title: While I was sleeping , she …….. the door.
While I was doing my work , the bell…..
The water …… can you turn the cooker off ?
Rice does not ...... in cold climate.
questionsData.explain_answer:
Here's why:

-Grew is the past tense of the verb "grow" and is used to talk about something that happened in the past (e.g., The rice grew well last summer).
-Grown is the past participle of "grow" and is used with helping verbs like "has" or "have" to form the perfect tenses (e.g., The rice has already been grown).
-Grows is the present tense, third-person singular form of "grow" and is used to talk about something that happens habitually or generally (e.g., The rice grows best in warm climates).
-In this sentence, we are talking about a general fact - rice does not typically grow in cold climates. So, we need the present tense verb form to indicate this habitual characteristic.
